dojg.description: A conjunction indicating the speaker/writer's feeling that there should be a very strong logical/natural connection between wht precedes the conjunction and what follows it.
dojg.meaning: Since; now that; once; if ~ at all; as long as; so long as

examples.japanese: (ksa).日本に来た以上(は)、日本語をしっかり勉強したい。
examples.english: Since I came to Japan, I would like to study Japanese  hard.

examples.japanese: (ksb).学生である以上(は)、勉強すべきだ。
examples.english: So long as you are a student, you should  study.

examples.japanese: (a).日本語を始めた以上、よく話せて、聞けて、読めて、書けるようになるまで頑張ります。
examples.english: Now that I have begun to study Japanese, I  will hang in there until I can speak and understand what I hear, and read and  write well.

examples.japanese: (b).新車を買う以上は、出来るだけ燃費のいいのを買いたいです。
examples.english: If I buy a new car at all, I would like to  buy one with good gas mileage.

examples.japanese: (c).親である以上、子供の教育に関心があるのは当然でしょう。
examples.english: If you are any sort of parent, you should be  interested in your child's education.

examples.japanese: (d).貰った以上は、あなたが何と言おうと、私の物です。
examples.english: Now that you have given this to me, it is  mine, no matter what you say.

examples.japanese: (e).体をよく動かしている以上は、人間の体は衰えないらしい。
examples.english: So long as you are very active, your body  seems to stay strong.

examples.japanese: (f).人と約束した以上は、それを守らなければならない。
examples.english: Once you have made a promise to someone, you  have to keep it.
